ÅšÄriputra!
If good men and good women uphold and recite the names of these buddhas, they will never enter hell and will quickly attain samÄdhi.
ÅšÄriputra!
Beyond these buddhas, after an incalculably long time, there was a buddha named NÄrÄyaá¹‡a. You should all single-mindedly take refuge in him.

The lifespan of that Buddha was seventy million eons. In the first assembly, three hundred million Å›rÄvaka disciples gathered, and eighty nayutas of ten thousands of bodhisattvas gathered, all of whom attained the various spiritual powers and the four unobstructed [abilities], penetrating all emptiness and reaching the other shore.
If I were to dwell in the world for immeasurable eons, speaking of the adornments of that Buddha's great assembly and country, it would be like a single drop of water from the great ocean.

We take refuge in such immeasurable and boundless pratyekabuddhas.
ÅšÄriputra!

If there are good sons, good women, bhiká¹£us, bhiká¹£uá¹‡Ä«s, upÄsakas, and upÄsikÄs who are able to uphold, recite, and chant the names of these buddhas and bodhisattvas, they will never fall into evil destinies but will be born among gods and humans. They will always encounter buddhas, bodhisattvas, and good and virtuous friends, will be far removed from all afflictions, and will attain great enlightenment.

After the Buddha had spoken this Buddha-name SÅ«tra, the Venerable ÅšÄriputra, the bhiká¹£u MahÄnÄman, and all the bhiká¹£us, bhiká¹£uá¹‡Ä«s, upÄsakas, and upÄsikÄs, as well as devas, nÄgas, yaká¹£as, gandharvas, asuras, garuá¸as, kiá¹ƒnaras, mahoragas, humans, non-humans, and all the bodhisattva mahÄsattvas, all greatly rejoiced and respectfully upheld and practiced it.
Having paid homage to the Three Jewels, we next repent.
Disciples!
Having repented the retributions of the three evil paths, we should now further bow our heads and repent the remaining retributions of humans and gods.

We share this lifespan in JambudvÄ«pa, though it is said to be a hundred years, few live to the full. In the meantime, the number of untimely deaths in one's prime is immeasurable. There are only various sufferings tormenting body and mind, with worries and fears never leaving for a moment. Such things are all due to the weakness of our wholesome roots and the abundance of our evil karma, causing our present minds to be unable to accomplish what we wish. We should know that these are all the remaining retributions of our evil karma from the past.
Therefore, disciple!
Today, with utmost sincerity, I take refuge in the Buddha.

Homage to the Buddha of Great Adornment in the East, Homage to the Buddha of Wisdom Fire in the South, Homage to the Buddha of Fragrant Wisdom in the West, Homage to the Buddha of Wisdom Power in the North, Homage to the Buddha of NÄrÄyaá¹‡a's Supreme Karmas in the Southeast, Homage to the Buddha of Raining Entertainment in the Southwest, Homage to the Buddha of the Truth Dharma's Universal Renown in the Northwest, Homage to the Buddha of the Three Vehicles' Practices in the Northeast, Homage to the Buddha of Great Penetrating Wisdom in the Nadir, Homage to the Buddha of Electric Lamp's Abundant Sovereignty in the Zenith. We take refuge in the Three Jewels throughout the ten directions and the entire Dharma realm.
Disciples!

From beginningless time until now, we have accumulated immeasurable remaining karmic retributions, past offenses, and karmic bonds in the realms of humans and gods. We repent of the karmic retribution of having incomplete faculties and various illnesses.
We repent of the karmic retribution of being born in borderlands with wrong views and the eight difficult circumstances.
Repenting of the karmic retribution of humans having many illnesses, emaciation, short lives, and premature deaths;

Repenting of the karmic retribution of humans not being able to always rely on and keep their six relatives;ğŸ”½Repenting of the karmic retribution of the suffering of humans' loved ones perishing and separation;
Repenting of the karmic retribution of humans gathering with enemies, feeling sorrowful and fearful;
Repenting of the karmic retribution of humans being in danger from water, fire, thieves, and weapons, and being frightened and terrified;

Repenting of the karmic retribution of humans being alone, suffering, displaced, and losing their homeland;ğŸ”½Repenting of the karmic retribution of humans being imprisoned, detained, standing at the side, being whipped, beaten, and tortured;
Repenting of the karmic retribution of humans having disputes in public and private, slandering each other, and defaming each other;
Repenting of the karmic retribution of humans having chronic illnesses for years and months without getting better, lying in bed unable to get up;
Repenting of the karmic retribution of humans having winter warmth and summer epidemics, toxic fevers, and cold injuries;
Repenting of the karmic retribution of being a human thief, being afflicted by wind and swelling, and being blocked;
Repenting of the karmic retribution of being a human being, being sought out by evil spirits, and being harmed by them;
Repenting of the karmic retribution of being a human being, having birds cry out a hundred strange things, and being harmed by flying corpses and evil ghosts;
Repenting of the karmic retribution of being a human being, being injured by tigers, leopards, wolves, jackals, and all kinds of evil birds and beasts on land and in water;
Repenting of the karmic retribution of being a human being, binding oneself, stabbing oneself, killing oneself, and harming oneself;
Repenting of the karmic retribution of being a human being, worrying about oneself, lamenting oneself, restraining oneself, being angry with oneself, and being happy with oneself;
Repenting of the karmic retribution of being a human being, throwing oneself into pits and fires, drowning oneself, and falling to one's death;
Repenting of the karmic retribution of being a human being, having no majestic virtue or fame;
Repenting of the karmic retribution of being a human being, not being able to obtain clothing and necessities to one's satisfaction;
Repenting of the karmic retribution of being a human being, encountering evil friends and encountering difficulties when going out and coming in, speaking and acting.
In this way, in the present and future, among humans and gods, I repent of the immeasurable calamities, disasters, misfortunes, and afflictions and offenses.
Disciples!
Today, with utmost sincerity, before the Buddhas, the Venerable Dharma, and the Holy Sangha in the ten directions, I bare my heart and reveal my mind, seeking their compassion and repenting.
May the disciples, by relying on the merit generated from repenting in this way, wish to be fully endowed with physical characteristics,
like RÄhula, always encounter the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha, and constantly hear the wonderful Dharma.
May their lifespans be equal to that of heaven and earth, and not be bound by a hundred illnesses. May their six relations and relatives always
be able to protect each other, and may they forever be free from enemies, thieves, and weapons. May their clothes naturally fill their chests and boxes,
and may a hundred flavors of fragrant rice always be abundant in their bowls. May prisons and confinement become heavenly paradises,
and may slander and mutual accusations transform into harmony. May illnesses lasting for years forever leave their bodies and minds, and may epidemicsğŸ”½and
All poisons and calamities are forever removed from the mind, and all strange apparitions, demons, flying birds, tigers, leopards, wolves,
and all calamities of water and land are gone without remainder;
whether it is self-mutilation, self-inflicted punishment, or self-anger and joy, all such offenses we vow to be forever separated from, from now until we attain Buddhahood.

We vow that disciples will not experience retribution in the evil paths, but will only give rise to great compassion to save and protect all beings, enabling them to exhaust their inherent nature, widely transform all kinds, and together ascend to perfect enlightenment.
The Sutra of the Questions and Answers of the Bodhisattva of the Lotus Treasure on Retribution, Scroll 1. Baota previously entered a hell where the skin is peeled off and blood is drunk.
Why is it called the hell where the skin is peeled off and blood is drunk?

The hell is seventy yojanas long and wide, surrounded by iron walls and covered with an iron net. Above the four gates of the city, molten iron flows down, covering the entire hell, blazing and burning.

There are also mechanical crossbows in the sky. When the sinners touch them, the crossbows fire by themselves, shooting into the sinners' chests, either through the eyes or through the mouth. Where the arrows strike, fierce fires erupt together.
At that time, in the southern gate, there were five thousand sinners, wailing and crying out, saying:
What sins have we committed to come into this place?
They rolled on the ground and refused to move forward.
The horse-headed rakshasa held an iron hook in his hand, hooked their faces, and dragged them into the prison.
Once the sinners entered, flying fire came to burn their bodies, causing their entire bodies to become charred and rotten, with the skin and flesh separating from each other.

There were then various kinds of worms that came to drink their blood, and the heads pulled and tugged at the skin and flesh, separating them. The prison guards and yakshas then tore them apart, with the bones and flesh going in different directions, causing myriad kinds of excruciating pain.

In a single day and night, they experienced immeasurable suffering, dying a thousand times and being reborn a thousand times, dying ten thousand times and being reborn ten thousand times, passing through myriad kalpas without any hope of release.
Baodala asked the horse-headed rakshasa:
For what causes and conditions do these sinners suffer such suffering?
The horse-headed rakshasa replied:

These sinners received the pure precepts of the Buddha but did not uphold them with determination, their minds lacked compassion, and with their hands they skinned sentient beings and killed the Buddha-nature. For this crime, they fell into this hell.

Later, if they escape, they will fall into the animal realm and for hundreds of thousands of millions of lives will be slaughtered by others. With enemies facing each other, there will be no end in sight. If they are born among humans, their faculties will be incomplete.
When Baodala heard this, he wept sorrowfully and left.Here is the corrected and aligned text:
